a term used when a company uses the same products they produce; Microsoft employees using Word is an example of "dogfooding"
it is an acronym for "for your information"; used in email to tell the reader that a given email is ust informative and does not need to be replied to.
"Looks Good To Me" is a phrase commonly used to indicate that a code integration can go ahead. For example, in a merge request.
"Out-Of-The-Box" is a phrase commonly used to describe the default features included in a library or language.
it is just an acronym for "paid time off"
When talking about platforms like GitHub or GitLab, both Pull Request and Merge Request refer to the same action: a request to integrate code from one branch o another.
is a term used to refer to the code created by code generation tools that help us when creating a new app. For example, yeoman is a scaffolding generator tool.
is a term used to refer to the code created by code generation tools that help us when creating a new app. For example, yeoman is a scaffolding generator tool.
an acronym for "too long; didn't read" commonly used to give a short summary of a larger piece of text
is a term used to refer to software in its purest form. For example, when someone says they did something in "vanilla JavaScript", it means they didn't use any framework.
